result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald L Crawford

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:12 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Reginald L Crawford in court.  Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews the case on the record and notes at the last hearing defendant needed to provide the PD's office with some additional information to see if he qualified for representation.  Court inquires if the defendant completed a conceal carry class if the State would be willing to amend.  State advises they do not make amendments to these types of cases and recites the offer.  Defendant advises he did not qualify for a Public Defender.  Court inquires if the defendant would like to have an attorney in this matter.  Defendant advises he does not plan to retain counsel and would like to accept the State's offer.  Court advises the defendant has a right to proceed without counsel but advises he could petition the Court for an attorney.  Defendant advises he would like to petition for a court appointed attorney.  Court takes a break at 11:16 a.m. to allow time for the defendant to fill out the petition for court appointed attorney.

Case recalled at 11:25 AM; all appearances remain the same.  Defendant presents statements and would like to resolve the matter today if possible.  Court inquires if the defendant has a prior record.  State advises he does.  Court advises the defendant that if he wants he can proceed and resolve the matter today, but needs to understand that based on the offer the defendant would still be pleading to a misdemeanor.  Defendant would like to accept the State's offer to resolve by way of a fine and resolve the matter, but is agreeable to setting the matter over to a new date.  Court will adjourn for projected plea and sentencing in about 30 days.  Court will provide the defendant with the waiver of right to attorney and plea questionnaire to be completed by the next court date.  Court will also return the petition for court appointed attorney to the defendant as well, and if he decides he would like counsel he should bring the petition back with him to  the next court date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:37 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Reginald L Crawford in court.  Court notes there is a stayed capias for the defendant's late appearance back on 8/15/2022.  Based on defendant's appearance today the court will quash the capias.  Court inquires as to whether the defendant plans to retain counsel.  Defendant advises that he went to the Public Defender's office but needs to provide them with some additional documents before they can assess whether he qualifies or not.  Defendant also mentions he plans to complete a CCW class. Court will adjourn for mid to late October to allow time for the defendant to provide additional info to PD's office or allow time for defendant to complete CCW class.  State recites the offer, noting there is no requirement for the CCW class.  Court will have the State make a note in the file for the ADA assigned to see if the defendant completes the CCW class that will make a difference in the offer.  Court adjourns for further proceedings in October.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:15 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Reginald L Crawford not in court. Court notes the defendant was present at the last hearing back on 07/11/2022 and was aware of the hearing scheduled for today.  Matter was set for 11:00 and it is now 11:16.  Court inquires as to what the offer is.  State advises upon a plea to the charge it will recommend a fine.  Court will authorize but stay the issuance of a Capias, and will adjourn for further proceedings in 30 days.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:23 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Reginald L Crawford in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires if the defendant plans to retain counsel.  Defendant advises that based on the offer he does not plan to retain counsel.  State recites the offer.  Court advises the defendant that the State would reduce the charge but is not dismissing the matter.  Court advises the defendant he would still need to plead to the criminal charge, so it would be up to him if he still wants to represent himself or retain counsel.  Court will provide the defendant with the information for the Public Defender's office, petition for court appointed attorney, waiver of right to attorney, and plea questionniare.  Court will adjourn for projected plea and sentencing in about 30 days.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms (the Defendant is allowed to possess/use a firearm if enrolled in a certified CCW class).

10:22 AM Defendant Reginald L Crawford in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Reginald L Crawford
Current: 5459 N 62nd St, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 06-09-2022)
Prior: 5642 N 62nd St, Milwaukee, WI 53206
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
